ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. JUN 25 1900
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIEVES

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
AND PINAR DEL RIO.
Quemados, Cuba, June 16, 1900.
Echeverria

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 38. }

1. Private John Burns, Troop B, 7th Cavalry, having
been tried by a general court-martial convened at Columbia
Barracks, Cuba, and found guilty of absence without leave,
in violation of the 32d Article of War, was sentenced “To
be confined at hard labor, under charge of the post guard, for one
(1) day. The court is thus lenient on account of the long con-
finement already served by the accused.”

In awarding this sentence the court violated the provi-
sions of paragraph 1, Circular No. 13, series 1899, Head-
quarters Department of the Province of Havana and Pinar
del Rio, and infringed upon the functions of the reviewing
authority. The proceedings were, therefore, returned to
the court for reconsideration.

In adhering to the original sentence the action of the
court is considered ill judged, and as having the effect to
impair discipline, and prejudice the interests of the Mili-
tary Service.

The sentence is disapproved. Private Burns will be re-
leased from confinement and restored to duty.

2. Private John Steele, Troop B, 7th Cavalry, having been
tried by a general court-martial convened at Columbia
Barracks, Cuba, and found guilty of absence without leave,
in violation of the 32d Article of War, was sentenced “To
be confined at hard labor, under charge of the post guard, for one
(1) day. The court is thus lenient on account of the long con-
finement already served by the accused.”

In awarding this sentence the court violated the provi-
sions of paragraph 1, Circular No. 13, series 1899, Head-
quarters Department of the Province of Havana and Pinar
del Rio, and infringed upon the functions of the reviewing
authority. The proceedings were, therefore, returned to
the court for reconsideration.

In adhering to the original sentence the action of the
court is considered ill judged, and as having the effect to
impair discipline, and prejudice the interests of the Mili-
tary Service.

The sentence is disapproved. Private Steele will be re-
leased from confinement and restored to duty.

3. Complying with instructions contained in an endorse-
ment from Headquarters Division of Cuba, dated June 15,
1900, a board of survey, to consist of:
Captain Medorem Crawford, 2d Artillery;
Captain George F. Barney, 2d Artillery;
2d Lieutenant E. B. Martindale, Jr., 2d Artillery;

is hereby ordered to convene at the Príncipe Quartermas-
ter Depot, Havana, Monday, the 18th instant, or as soon
thereafter as practicable, for the purpose of reporting upon
the condition of an ambulance reported by the Chief Quar-
termaster, Division of Cuba, as in stock at the Príncipe
Quartermaster Depot, Havana; and of appraising and fix-
ing the price for which same may be sold to the Municipal-
ity of Regla, in accordance with the rulings contained in
paragraph 1241 Revised Statutes.

4. Major Rafael Echeverría, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers,
having reported for duty at these headquarters, in compli-
ance with paragraph 1, Special Orders No. 88, c. s., Head-
quarters Division of Cuba, is, upon the recommendation of
the Chief Surgeon, assigned to duty at the camp of civilian
non-immunes to be established in the vicinity of Quemados.

BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:

R. E. L. MICHIE,
Assistant Adjutant General.
